intro: Pedicularis aquilina, commonly known as the Alpine Monkeyflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Pedicularis aquilina is noted for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
